member.name: T:MeaMod.DNS.Model.Message
member.summary: All communications inside of the domain protocol are carried in a single format called a message.

member.name: F:MeaMod.DNS.Model.Message.opcode4
member.summary: The least significant 4 bits of the opcode.

member.name: F:MeaMod.DNS.Model.Message.MaxLength
member.summary: Maximum bytes of a message.
member.remarks:
In reality the max length is dictated by the network MTU. For legacy IPv4 systems, 512 bytes should be used. For DNSSEC, at least 4096 bytes are needed.
9000 bytes (less IP and UPD header lengths) is specified by Multicast DNS.

member.name: F:MeaMod.DNS.Model.Message.MinLength
member.summary: Minimum bytes of a messages

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.Message.Id
member.summary: A 16 bit identifier assigned by the program that generates any kind of query. This identifier is copied the corresponding reply and can be used by the requester to match up replies to outstanding queries.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.Message.QR
member.summary: A one bit field that specifies whether this message is a query(0), or a response(1).
member.value: false for a query; otherwise, true for a response.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.Message.IsQuery
member.summary: Determines if the message is query.
member.value: true for a query; otherwise, false for a response.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.Message.IsResponse
member.summary: Determines if the message is a response to a query.
member.value: false for a query; otherwise, true for a response.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.Message.Opcode
member.summary: The requested operation.
member.value: One of the values. Both standard and extended values are supported.
member.remarks:
This value is set by the originator of a query and copied into the response.
Extended opcodes (values requiring more than 4 bits) are split between the message header and the in the section. When setting an extended opcode, the will be created if it does not already exist.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.Message.AA
member.summary:
Authoritative Answer - this bit is valid in responses, and specifies that the responding name server is an authority for the domain name in question section.
Note that the contents of the answer section may have multiple owner names because of aliases.The AA bit corresponds to the name which matches the query name, or the first owner name in the answer section.
member.value: true for an authoritative answer; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.Message.TC
member.summary: TrunCation - specifies that this message was truncated due to length greater than that permitted on the transmission channel.
member.value: true for a truncated message; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.Message.RD
member.summary:
Recursion Desired - this bit may be set in a query and is copied into the response. If RD is set, it directs the name server to pursue the query recursively.
Recursive query support is optional.
member.value: true if recursion is desired; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.Message.RA
member.summary: Recursion Available - this be is set or cleared in a response, and denotes whether recursive query support is available in the name server.
member.value: true if recursion is available; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.Message.Z
member.summary: Reserved for future use.
member.value: Must be zero in all queries and responses.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.Message.AD
member.summary: Authentic data.
member.value: true if the response data is authentic; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Only used in a response and indicates that all the data included in the and sections are authenticated by the server according to its DNSSEC policies.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.Message.CD
member.summary: Checking disabled.
member.value: true if the query does not require authenticated data; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Only used in a query and indicates that pending (non-authenticated) data is acceptable to the resolver sending the query.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.Message.DO
member.summary: Indicates that DNS Security Extensions (DNSSEC) are supported.
member.value: true if DNSSEC is supported; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: The DO bit is actually in the , when setting the record is added to if not already present.

member.name: T:MeaMod.DNS.Model.NSRecord
member.summary: An authoritative name server.
member.remarks:
NS records cause both the usual additional section processing to locate a type A record, and, when used in a referral, a special search of the zone in which they reside for glue information.
The NS RR states that the named host should be expected to have a zone starting at owner name of the specified class. Note that the class may not indicate the protocol family which should be used to communicate with the host, although it is typically a strong hint.For example, hosts which are name servers for either Internet (IN) or Hesiod (HS) class information are normally queried using IN class protocols.

member.name: T:MeaMod.DNS.Model.OPTRecord
member.summary: An extension mechanism for DNS (EDNS(0)).
member.remarks:
An OPT record does not carry any DNS data. It is used only to contain control information pertaining to the question-and-answer sequence of a specific transaction. OPT RRs MUST NOT be cached, forwarded, or stored in or loaded from master files.
The OPTRecord can be present in the section.
The property is repurposed to specify the requestor's payload size.
The property is repurposed to specify the , and properties.

member.name: T:MeaMod.DNS.Model.SOARecord
member.summary: Marks the start of a zone of authority.
member.remarks: Most of these fields are pertinent only for name server maintenance operations. However, MINIMUM is used in all query operations that retrieve RRs from a zone.Whenever a RR is sent in a response to a query, the TTL field is set to the maximum of the TTL field from the RR and the MINIMUM field in the appropriate SOA.Thus MINIMUM is a lower bound on the TTL field for all RRs in a zone.Note that this use of MINIMUM should occur when the RRs are copied into the response and not when the zone is loaded from a master file or via a zone transfer. The reason for this provison is to allow future dynamic update facilities to change the SOA RR with known semantics.

member.name: T:MeaMod.DNS.Model.UpdateMessage
member.summary: Dynamic updates in the Domain Name System.

remarks.para: RFC 2136 allows adding or deleting resource records from a specified zone.
are specified separately from update operations, and can specify a dependency upon either the previous existence or nonexistence of an RRset, or the existence of a single RR.

An update is atomic, i.e., all prerequisites must be satisfied or else no update operations will take place. There are no data dependent error conditions defined after the prerequisites have been met.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.UpdateMessage.Id
member.summary: A 16 bit identifier assigned by the program that generates any kind of update.
member.value: A unique identifier assigned by the requestor.
member.remarks: This identifier is copied to the corresponding response and can be used by the requestor to match up replies to outstanding queries.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.UpdateMessage.QR
member.summary: Determines if the message is a request or a response.
member.value: 0 if the message is a request or 1 if the message is a response.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.UpdateMessage.IsUpdate
member.summary: Determines if the message is an update.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.UpdateMessage.IsResponse
member.summary: Determines if the message is a response to an update.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.UpdateMessage.Opcode
member.summary: The kind of message.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.UpdateMessage.Z
member.summary: Reserved for future use. Must be zero in all updates and responses.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.UpdateMessage.Status
member.summary: Response code - this 4 bit field is set as part of responses.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.UpdateMessage.Zone
member.summary: The zone to update.
member.value: Defaults to the empty zone. is null, is and is SOA (6).

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.UpdateMessage.Prerequisites
member.summary: Resource records which must (not) preexist.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.UpdateMessage.Updates
member.summary: Resource records to be added or deleted.

member.name: P:MeaMod.DNS.Model.UpdateMessage.AdditionalResources
member.summary: The list of additional resource records.
member.remarks:
The resources which are related to the update itself, or to new resources being added by the update. For example, out of zone glue (A RRs referred to by new NS RRs) should be presented here.
The server can use or ignore out of zone glue, at the discretion of the server implementor.

member.name: M:MeaMod.DNS.Model.UpdateMessage.CreateResponse
member.summary: Create a response for the update message.

member.name: T:MeaMod.DNS.Model.UpdatePrerequisiteList
member.summary: Preconditions for a update.
member.remarks:
The list of resource records which must be satisfied before an can proceed.
MustExist and MustNotExist are convenience methods to create the various preconditions.

member.name: M:MeaMod.DNS.Model.UpdatePrerequisiteList.MustExist(MeaMod.DNS.Model.DomainName,MeaMod.DNS.Model.DnsType)
member.summary: At least one resource record with the specified name and type must exist in the .
member.param: One of the RR TYPE codes.
member.returns: The prerequisite list to allow fluent usage.
member.remarks: For this prerequisite, a requestor adds to the section a single RR whose NAME and TYPE are equal to that of the zone RRset whose existence is required. RDLENGTH is zero and RDATA is therefore empty. CLASS must be specified as ANY to differentiate this condition from that of an actual RR whose RDLENGTH is naturally zero (0) (e.g., NULL). TTL is specified as zero(0).

member.name: M:MeaMod.DNS.Model.UpdatePrerequisiteList.MustExist(MeaMod.DNS.Model.DomainName)
member.summary: At least one resource record with the specified name must exist in the .
member.returns: The prerequisite list to allow fluent usage.
member.remarks: For this prerequisite, a requestor adds to the section a single RR whose NAME is equal to that of the name whose ownership of an RR is required. RDLENGTH is zero and RDATA is therefore empty. CLASS must be specified as ANY to differentiate this condition from that of an actual RR whose RDLENGTH is naturally zero (0) (e.g., NULL). TYPE must be specified as ANY to differentiate this case from that of an RRset existence test. TTL is specified as zero (0).

member.summary: At least one resource record with the specified name and type must exist in the .
member.returns: The prerequisite list to allow fluent usage.
member.remarks: For this prerequisite, a requestor adds to the section a single RR whose NAME is equal to that of the name whose ownership of an RR is required. RDLENGTH is zero and RDATA is therefore empty. CLASS must be specified as ANY to differentiate this condition from that of an actual RR whose RDLENGTH is naturally zero (0) (e.g., NULL). TYPE must be specified as ANY to differentiate this case from that of an RRset existence test. TTL is specified as zero (0).

member.summary: A resource record exists with the specified NAME, TYPE and RDATA.
member.returns: The prerequisite list to allow fluent usage.
member.remarks: For this prerequisite, a requestor adds to the section an entire RRset whose preexistence is required. NAME and TYPE are that of the RRset being denoted. CLASS is that of the zone. TTL must be specified as zero (0) and is ignored when comparing RRsets for identity.

member.name: M:MeaMod.DNS.Model.UpdatePrerequisiteList.MustNotExist(MeaMod.DNS.Model.DomainName,MeaMod.DNS.Model.DnsType)
member.summary: No resource record with the specified name and type can exist in the .
member.param: One of the RR TYPE codes.
member.returns: The prerequisite list to allow fluent usage.
member.remarks: For this prerequisite, a requestor adds to the section a single RR whose NAME and TYPE are equal to that of the RRset whose nonexistence is required. The RDLENGTH of this record is zero (0), and RDATA field is therefore empty. CLASS must be specified as NONE in order to distinguish this condition from a valid RR whose RDLENGTH is naturally zero (0) (for example, the NULL RR). TTL must be specified as zero(0).

member.name: M:MeaMod.DNS.Model.UpdatePrerequisiteList.MustNotExist(MeaMod.DNS.Model.DomainName)

member.returns: The prerequisite list to allow fluent usage.
member.remarks: For this prerequisite, a requestor adds to the section a single RR whose NAME is equal to that of the name whose nonownership of any RRs is required. RDLENGTH is zero and RDATA is therefore empty. CLASS must be specified as NONE. TYPE must be specified as ANY. TTL must be specified as zero (0).

Sends a MDNS response containing the pointer and resource records of the .
To provide increased robustness against packet loss, two unsolicited responses are sent one second apart.
